results.title: Left-handed children: a guide for teachers and parents
results.brief_description: An instructional documentary for parents and teachers dealing with left-handed children. In addition to revealing interesting facts about the number of left-handed people in the community, “Left-handed children” provides vital tips for a range of activities as diverse as hand writing, using scissors, using a ruler, pencil-sharpening, calligraphy, using a computer keyboard and mouse, tying shoe-laces, craft-work, using kitchen utensils and playing sport. As left-handed children may be more vulnerable to feelings of self-doubt because of their difficulty in adopting ‘right-handed’ tools and approaches, this documentary is an essential and invaluable guide.

results.title: Lectures are a drag
results.brief_description: An “average” class of high school students is observed during a spirited discussion on the Bill of Rights. Techniques used by the teachers in directing the discussion are pointed out. At the end the students make statements on their feeling of involvement in the enquiry and discussion.

results.title: Leaving it to the experts
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In order to be an effective member of a community is it an individual’s responsibility to keep informed? Two farmers argue the point when one of them is invited to join a group studying international affairs. He says a farmer has enough to do with his own problems, and the world’s affairs can be best left to the experts. The audience is invited to carry the discussion further.

results.title: Leave me alone: sexual harassment in the workplace
results.creator_credit: Nick Frazer, Ian MacArthur and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Made for the National Committee on Discrimination in Employment and Occupation. Provides examples of unwelcome behaviour of a sexual nature which may or may not be sexual harassment and invites discussion. It attempts to assist managers to recognise the consequences of sexual harassment to an organisation, suggests how an organisation might respond to the issue and provides guidance to managers and supervisors on the skills required to handle the problem. Accompanied by an 18p. manual of the same title.

results.title: Leave Britney Alone
results.brief_description: “Leave Britney Alone” is a viral video in which YouTube celebrity Chris Crocker cries while pleading with viewers to leave pop star Britney Spears alone.

results.title: Leave 'em laughing
results.creator_credit: Jackie Cooper, Julian Fowles and Charles Fries Productions
results.brief_description: This made for television drama based on the life story of the much-loved Chicago circus clown, Jack Thum, stars Mickey Rooney in one of his most poignant and memorable roles along with Anne Jackson as Shirlee, Thum’s loving and devoted wife. Cast also includes Allen Goorwitz, Elisha Cook, Michael Le Clair, William Windom, Red Buttons.

results.title: Leather jackets (Tipulidae)
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the crane fly or “daddy-long-legs” the larvae of which, called Leather Jackets, feed just below the surface of the soil destroying the roots and underground portions of the plants. Stages shown include the action of the larvae in the soil; the pupation stage; emergence of the adult crane fly; reproduction of species; laying of eggs; finally, hatching of the young Leather Jackets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Leather
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basic techniques of an ancient craft that has a recent renaissance. The techniques covered in this excellent introduction to the leather work’s art will stimulate creativity and original design.

results.title: Learning together: the handicapped person in the community
results.brief_description: Looks at two children, one with cerebral palsy and the other almost totally blind, at a nursery school which takes a small number of handicapped children alongside its non-handicapped. We see them engaged in various activities as the headmistress talks about the implications and advantages of having them in the school.

results.title: Learning to use your senses
results.creator_credit: Arthur R. Botham and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the functions of the five senses - sight, hearing, touch, smell and taste - and shows how to recognise situations relevant to each of the five senses in the context of a birthday party.
